Councillor numbers

We decide how many councillors an authority should have.

Dates: 25 Jan 2022 - 11 Jul 2022

We review the electoral and boundary arrangements of councils to make sure they are fair. Our reviews include at least two rounds of public consultation before we make recommendations for change. 

We are carrying out an electoral review of Fareham because it has been a long time since the last review.

25 January 2022 We decide how many councillors there should be
25 January - 11 July 2022 We carry out an initial public consultation on communities
6 September - 15 November 2022 We carry out a public consultation on our proposals
7 February 2023 We publish our recommendations
April 2023 We ask Parliament to approve our recommendations
2024 New arrangements apply to local elections

 

Visit our 'How reviews work' pages for more information on the review process.  

Latest Information

Making our recommendation into law

Our recommendations have become law

The Fareham (Electoral Changes) Order 2023 was made on 14 July 2023.

Officers within the council will now make sure the new arrangements are in place for elections held after May 2024.

The Fareham (Electoral Changes) Order 2023
View (opens in a new tab)
Map referred to in the Order
View & Download
Parliamentary scrutiny of our recommendations

A Draft Fareham (Electoral Changes) Order 2023 was laid in Parliament on 18 May 2023. 

If there is no successful objection by a member of the Commons or Lords within 40 parliamentary sitting days the draft Order will become law.  

The Fareham (Electoral Changes) Order 2023
View (opens in a new tab)
Map referred to in the Draft Order
